newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai baht stable late, interbank rate eases.
newsitem.headline: Thai baht stable late, interbank rate eases.

text.p: The Thai baht was steady against the dollar in late sluggish trade on Thursday as the U.S. unit remained range-bound abroad, dealers said.
The baht was trading at 26.073/26.080 to the dollar late against 26.073/26.078 earlier, dealers said.
"I have fallen asleep many times today. There was nothing exciting just like the quiet overseas markets," said one dealer at a European bank.
He said dollar demand was drying out following the greenback's slight fall against major currencies.
The central bank set the midrate at 26.08 per dollar compared with 26.09 on Wednesday.
The overnight interbank rate dipped to 8.00-8.25 percent late from 8.50 in the morning on slow demand for funds, dealers said.
"The low swap premiums also prompted some banks to borrow funds through the swap market rather than the money market," said one money market dealer.
The one-month baht/dollar swap premium was quoted unchanged late at 5.50/6.00 satangs per dollar.
